details.title: Counting to begin at 8 am
details.content: Counting for all 70 assembly seats in Delhi to begin at 8 am.

details.title: Delhi traffic alert
details.content: Delhi Traffic Police: Traffic movement will remain closed on Muni Maya Ram Marg near Guru Nanak Dev Institute of Technology (both carriageways) due to vote counting today.

details.title: AAP supporter reaches Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence with his children
details.content:
#DelhiElections2020: An Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) supporter reaches Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence with his children. Counting for all 70 assembly seats in Delhi to begin at 8 am. pic.twitter.com/jFG9M6VZ4W

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: Is Delhi a defence of democracy lab?
details.content: Arguably, the most significant feature of the Indian electoral scenario is the contrast between parliamentary and Assembly polls. If Modi is truly invincible, he should be so not only in parliamentary polls but also in state elections. (READ MORE)

details.title: Ahead of results, BJP leader Vijay Goel offers prayers
details.content:
Delhi: BJP leader Vijay Goel offered prayers at Hanuman Temple in Connaught Place. Counting for all 70 assembly seats in Delhi to begin at 8 am. #DelhiResults pic.twitter.com/CDbtQXGAqC

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: Delhi elections 2015 results saw AAP grabbing 67 seats
Counting begins
details.content:
Counting of votes begins, visuals from a counting centre in Maharani Bagh. #DelhiResults pic.twitter.com/PzyFNLe9Em

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: Written off by pollsters, Congress hopeful of springing a surprise
details.content: The Congress said it is hopeful of winning at least 10 seats in the Assembly, even though the exit polls say otherwise. (READ MORE)

details.title: Five years AAP worked for people: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia shows confidence
details.content:
Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia: We are confident of a win today because we have worked for people in the last 5 years. https://t.co/kBIW1zRSjH pic.twitter.com/eUuiVKSsk5

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: Don't be surprised if BJP wins 55 seats, says confident Manoj Tiwari on counting day
details.content:
Manoj Tiwari, BJP Delhi Chief: I am not nervous. I am confident that it will be a good day for BJP. We are coming to power in Delhi today. Don't be surprised if we win 55 seats. #DelhiResults pic.twitter.com/3xPHnd6qNf

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: Pollution check: Kejriwal says 'no celebratory crackers'
details.content: Party functionaries said though preparations are underway to celebrate the victory in the polls, whose results will be announced today, Kejriwal has asked party volunteers not to burst firecrackers as it contributes to pollution. (READ MORE)

details.title: Security beefed up outside counting centres
details.content:
Security beefed up outside counting centres in #Delhi.#DelhiResults
Express photos by @parveennegi1 and @Shekharyadav02.
LIVE: https://t.co/nKmMUgmu9I pic.twitter.com/mTZfjGmJAL

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) February 11, 2020

details.title: Delhi recorded 62.59 per cent voter turnout
details.content: Delhi went to polls on February 8. The capital recorded a 62.59 per cent voter turnout as announced by the Election Commission. However, the 'delay' was questioned by AAP as it was declared only on Sunday evening.

details.title: EVMs being used to tally ballots
details.content: Election officials use EVMs to tally ballots for the Delhi polls. The vote counting is underway in several polling centres amid high security. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: What a loss in Delhi Assembly elections would mean for Arvind Kejriwal or Amit Shah
details.content: In this battle for the nation's capital, one has to lose. While the celebration will be at its loudest at one party headquarter, the silence will be strikingly deafening in the other party office. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kejriwal leads in New Delhi constituency, AAP confident about victory
details.content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal is leading from New Delhi constituency as seen in the early trends. Aam Aadmi Party has also taken a lead in 51 out of 70 seats. In the 2015 Assembly Elections, AAP had defeated rival parties, winning 67 of the 70 seats. While the Congress saw a massive defeat winning zero seats, BJP was reduced to just three.

details.title: Congress candidate from Vikas Puri concedes defeat
details.content:
Within hours of vote counting, Congress candidate Mukesh Sharma from Vikas Puri conceded defeat on Twitter. While showing gratitude towards Congress workers and voters of Vikaspuri , he vowed to continue his fight.

मैं अपनी हार स्वीकार करते हुए, विकासपुरी विधानसभा क्षेत्र के सभी मतदाताओं व कांग्रेस कार्यकर्ताओं का आभार व्यक्त करता हूं और आशा करता हूं कि क्षेत्र का चौमुखी विकास होगा।

मैं भविष्य में भी दिल्ली, विकासपुरी व उत्तम नगर विधानसभा क्षेत्र के चौमुखी विकास के लिए लड़ाई लड़ता रहूंगा।

— Mukesh Sharma (@MukeshSharmaMLA) February 11, 2020

details.title: Early trends: AAP leader Atishi trails in Kalkaji constituency
details.content: What is being seen as a surprise, AAP leader Atishi is trailing from Kalkaji constituency. While Congress leader Alka Lamba is seen trailing in her Chandini Chowk constituency. Chandni Chowk has been a seat from where Congress has won five times.

details.title: AAP begins celebrations at party HQ after 'positive' early trends
details.content: (AAP workers celebrate at party headquarters in New Delhi. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: EC update: AAP ahead in 13 seats, while BJP leads in 11
Congress' Alka Lamba trailing in Chandini Chowk
details.content:
Delhi's Chandni Chowk assembly constituency: AAP's Parlad Singh Sawhney at 6043 votes, Congress's Alka Lamba at 157 votes and BJP's Suman Kumar Gupta at 67 votes. pic.twitter.com/g8DU79hOIp

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: BJP leading in Okhla constituency
details.content: Okhla constituency: The constituency which houses Shaheen Bagh, the area where massive anti-CAA protests are being held for over five weeks, BJP's Braham Singh was leading by 214 votes while AAP's Amanatullah Khan trails.

details.title: AAP footprint strong across all seven Lok Sabha seats
details.content: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, who contested from New Delhi assembly seat was leading by over 2,000 votes to BJP's Sunil Yadav, while Deputy Chief Minister and AAP's Manish Sisodia was leading by over 100 votes to BJP's Ravi Negi from Patparganj assembly constituency. (READ MORE)

details.title: AAP victory against BJP's communal agenda to be significant: Congress MP
details.content:
Congress MP AR Chowdhury: Everyone knew that Aam Aadmi Party will return to power for the third time. Congress's defeat will not send a good message. The victory of AAP against the Bharatiya Janata Party & its communal agenda is significant. pic.twitter.com/HD2vQhFfpn

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: Health warning
details.content: These leads are based on early trends. The lead margins in most seats are too small to be counted.

details.title: AAP celebrations reaches Punjab
details.content: Aam Aadmi Party workers in Amritsar celebrate as trends indicate win for the party.

details.title: Second round trends: AAP leading in 52 seats, BJP leads in 18
details.content: Second round of counting shows Aam Aadmi Party's Pramila Tokas leading from RK Puram, Akhilesh Pati Tripathi leading from Model Town. AAP leading in 52 seats and BJP leading in 18 seats.

details.title: 'Give a missed call, join AAP'
details.content: AAP to launch a new missed call number for people to join AAP. (Photo | Siddhanta Mishra, EPS)

details.title: Tough fight for Manish Sisodia in Patparganj constituency
details.content: Patparganj assembly constituency: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia trailing behind BJP's Ravi Negi by 1427 votes after third round of counting.

details.title: Shaheen Bagh effect? AAP’s Amanatullah Khan leading in Okhla constituency
details.content: Currently held by Amanatullah Khan, trends show AAP leading in Okhla. Shaheen Bagh, the site of anti-CAA protests, falls in the Okhla constituency.

details.title: Dhillon Vs Tajinder Bagga in Hari Nagar
details.content: After fifth round of voting, AAP's Raj Kumari Dhillon leading against Bharatiya Janata Party's Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga from Hari Nagar constituency.

details.title: Should search Sheila Dikshit's alternative: Abhishek Manu Singhvi
details.content:
As the counting for new Delhi Assembly is underway, Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi tweeted saying the party should look for an alternative to Sheila Dikshit and back him/ her for next five years. These were the first elections Congress fought in the capital without former Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit.

Ask my friends, tv channels today, In court, In parliament. I had said bjp wl b near 15. Looks like that. #delhielections #AAP latter have done reasonably good work in edu, Health & sahayaks. #INC has 2search 4 an alternative shiela face& back him/ her for4 years starting now.

— Abhishek Singhvi (@DrAMSinghvi) February 11, 2020

details.title: Lage raho Kejriwal: AAP supporters dance it out after trends show massive leads
details.content:
As early leads suggest a favourable win for AAP, members and supporters of party celebrate in New Delhi.
Express video by @Shekharyadav02.#DelhiElectionResults #DelhiResults #ResultOnDelhi
LIVE: https://t.co/inozPtdWjV pic.twitter.com/khJTVd77Rd

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) February 11, 2020

details.title: Hate speech during Delhi polls: Court seeks cops' report on complaint against Anurag Thakur, Pravesh Verma
details.content: Union Minister Anurag Thakur had raised the slogan 'Desh Ke Gaddaro Ko, Goli Maaro Sa*** Ko' (shoot the traitors) several times while addressing a public meeting. On the other hand,Parvesh Verma had said 'Shaheen Bagh protesters will rape your sisters and daughters, kill them.' (READ MORE)

details.title: Prashant Kishor thanks Delhiites for 'saving India's soul'
details.content:
Roped by Aam Aadmi Party as their poll strategist ahead of elections, Prashant Kishor 'thanks' people of Delhi.

Thank you Delhi for standing up to protect the soul of India!

— Prashant Kishor (@PrashantKishor) February 11, 2020

details.title: Priority is ensuring accuracy in counting: Delhi Chief Electoral Officer
details.content: 'We have made all the needed arrangements for security. The counting had begun on time with the postal ballots and all the work is being done as per the Election Commission guidelines,' Delhi Chief Electoral Officer Ranbir Singh said. (READ MORE)

details.title: On result day, silent protest observed in Shaheen Bagh against police action in Jamia
details.content:
At Shaheen Bagh, a silent protest is being observed against the police action at #Jamia yesterday. They have decided to not speak on the day of #DelhiElectionResults claiming that the protesters do not support any political party. @NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard pic.twitter.com/TL2YkOp2LE

— Rahiba R. Parveen (@RahibaParveen) February 11, 2020

details.title: Aaj Hindustan jeet gaya: Sanjay Singh celebrates at AAP HQ
details.content: Aam Aadmi Party leaders Sanjay Singh, ND Gupta and Sushil Gupta celebrate at party office as the party takes big lead according to official EC trends.

details.title: Congress Delhi chief takes responsibility for party's poor performance
details.content: 'I take responsibility for the party's performance, we will analyse the factors behind this. Reason for the drop in our vote percentage is politics of polarization by both BJP and AAP.' said Congress Delhi  chief Subhash Chopra.

details.title: AAP workers celebrate as party takes big lead
Amanatullah Khan leaves BJP behind in Okhla
details.content: AAP's Amantullah Khan now leading by 70514 votes from Okhla constituency.

details.title: Early wishes for AAP, Mamata Banerjee congratulates Kejriwal
details.content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee congratulated Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for Delhi election results. Tweets 'People have rejected BJP. Only development will work, CAA, NRC and NPR will be rejected.

details.title: Congress decimated again: Sharmistha Mukherjee lists reasons for party's poor show
details.content: Congress, which ruled Delhi consecutively for 15 years from 1998 to 2013, could not manage to win a single seat in the last elections of 2015. (READ MORE)

details.title: JUST IN: AAP's Bandana Kumari wins Shalimar Bagh with 800 votes
details.content: The Election Commission officials announced that Aam Aadmi Party’s Bandana Kumari won by around 800 votes against Rekha Gupta of the Bharatiya Janata Party from Shalimar Bagh assembly constituency.

details.title: Couldn't convince people of Delhi: BJP leaders concede defeat
details.content:
BJP MP from East Delhi, Gautam Gambhir: We accept #DelhiElectionResults and congratulate Arvind Kejriwal & the people of Delhi. We tried our best but, probably, we could not convince the people of the state. I hope Delhi develops under the chief ministership of Arvind Kejriwal. pic.twitter.com/GO4HG7s5fI

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: Arvind Kejriwal has turned Delhi into a counter-Hindutva laboratory, writes Valson Thampu
details.content: The BJP, for all its mammoth efforts and the evident desperation to annex Delhi, has come a cropper. It is impossible to improve on the comprehensiveness, aggression and communal divisiveness of the campaign that the BJP mounted. (READ MORE)

details.title: Congratulations on resounding victory: Pinarayi Vijayan wishes Kejriwal-led AAP
details.content:
Congratulations to @ArvindKejriwal and @AamAadmiParty on a resounding victory in Delhi elections. Let this victory be a harbinger for pro-people and inclusive politics in our country. pic.twitter.com/oJYbH7YsA3

— Pinarayi Vijayan (@vijayanpinarayi) February 11, 2020

details.title: 'Victory of work over hatred' says AAP's Amanatullah Khan
details.content: Leading from Okhla constituency, Amanatullah Khan, the AAP candidate, has strengthened his lead by a margin of 21,174 votes. Talking to reporters, Khan said the 'voters of Delhi have made the BJP and Amit Shah felt the current. This is the victory of work over hatred.'

details.title: Amid counting of Delhi poll results, L-G Anil Baijal dissolves Assembly
details.content: 'Lt Governor Anil Baijal on Tuesday dissolved the Sixth Legislative Assembly of the National Capital Territory of Delhi with effect from February 11,' an official said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Development trumps communal politics: MK Stalin congratulates AAP, Kejriwal for poll results
details.content:
I congratulate @ArvindKejriwal and @AamAadmiParty for forming government yet again in Delhi,on a massive mandate.

This is clear vindication that development trumps communal politics.

Federal rights and regional aspirations must be strengthened in the interest of our country.

— M.K.Stalin (@mkstalin) February 11, 2020

details.title: Not death of Congress: Party assures after second consecutive defeat in capital
details.content:
'We will again strengthen the Congress at the ground level. We will continue to work for unity and integrity of the country. We do not discriminate, this has been the tradition of Congress.'
 

There is no dearth of Congress workers. Our strength will be seen in the upcoming municipal elections: @KirtiAzaad

— Congress Live (@INCIndiaLive) February 11, 2020

details.title: JUST IN | Manish Sisodia trails BJP's Ravi Negi by over 1000 votes
details.content: After 10th round of counting, Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia is trailing behind BJP's Ravi Negi by 1223 votes in Patparganj assembly constituency.

details.title: JUST IN | Manish Sisodia trails BJP's Ravi Negi by over 1000 votes
details.content: After 10th round of counting, Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia is trailing behind BJP's Ravi Negi by 1223 votes in Patparganj assembly constituency.

details.title: Party workers celebrate poll trends as Kejriwal set to retain Chief Minister post
details.content: AAP members and supporters celebrate as party set to retain power in New Delhi. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: Celebrations begin: Kejriwal celebrates with wife as AAP takes lead
UPDATE | Trends show Manish Sisodia now leading in Patparganj
details.content: Delhi Deputy CM and Aam Aadmi Party's Manish Sisodia now leading by 3129 votes after 13th round of counting from Patparganj assembly constituency.

details.title: Trends suggest AAP heading for big win in Delhi
details.content:
#DelhiElectionResults | Trends suggest a landslide victory for AAP in #DelhiElection2020.
LIVE: https://t.co/inozPtdWjV pic.twitter.com/1aKWlUTEEd

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) February 11, 2020

details.title: AAP grabs Rajinder Nagar seat, Raghav Chadha celebrates win
details.content: AAP leader Raghav Chadha celebrates with party workers after winning from Rajinder Nagar constituency. The 31-year-old national spokesperson is one of the party’s youngest candidates. (Photo | Express)

details.title: JUST IN | AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal to address media at 3.30 pm
details.content: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal to address volunteers and media at party headquarters around 3.30 pm.

details.title: AAP's Atishi wins Delhi's Kalkaji seat
Politics of hatred did not work in Delhi: Mamata Banerjee
details.content: Mamata Banerjee, who made a phone call to AAP supremo and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to congratulate him on his party's resounding success, later told media that the BJP was losing every poll. (READ MORE)

details.title: Happy to become MLA again: Manish Sisoda after win
details.content:
Delhi Deputy CM and Aam Aadmi Party's Manish Sisodia has won from Patparganj assembly constituency after giving a tough fight to BJP's Ravi Verma. 

Aam Aadmi Party's Manish Sisodia: I am happy to become the MLA from Patparganj assembly constituency again. BJP tried to do politics of hate but people of Delhi chose a government that works for the people. #DelhiElectionResults pic.twitter.com/sQ5UZLHHNA

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: BJP's Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga admits defeat
details.content:
क्‍या हार में क्‍या जीत में,किंचित नहीं भयभीत मैं ।
संघर्ष पथ पर जो भी मिला, यह भी सही वह भी सही।
हरि नगर विधानसभा के सभी मतदाताओं का और सभी कार्यकर्ता मित्रों का हार्दिक धन्यवाद ।

— Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga (@TajinderBagga) February 11, 2020

details.title: BJP puts up posters accepting defeat in Delhi polls
details.content: A poster in the Delhi BJP office has a photo of Union Home Minister Amit Shah and reads 'Victory doesn't makes us arrogant, defeat doesn't demoralise us'. (ALSO READ)

details.title: Here is how Delhi voted
details.content:
Take a look at the #DelhiElectionResults vote share.
LIVE: https://t.co/inozPtdWjV pic.twitter.com/4qNaHfV55t

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) February 11, 2020

details.title: Thanks Delhi for considering me your son: Victorious Arvind Kejriwal celebrates win
details.content:
AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal: I thank people of Delhi for reposing their faith in AAP for the third time. This the victory of the people who consider me as their son and voted for us. #DelhiElectionResults pic.twitter.com/Txq1O92tso

— ANI (@ANI) February 11, 2020

details.title: A few key takeways of Delhi result day
details.content:
• Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP is maintaining a strong lead in 63 seats while BJP is far behind at 7.
  • AAP leaders Atishi, Manish Sisodia, Raghav Chadha were among the big winners from the party.
  • Former AAP leader and current Congress member Alka Lamba lost from Chandini Chowk constituency.
  • In Okhla, which houses anti-CAA protestors hub Shaheen Bagh, AAP's Amanatullah Khan defeated BJP candidate.
  • BJP Delhi chief Manoj Tiwari conceded defeat and took 'full responsibility for BJP's performance.'
  • 'Not Death of Congress,' said Delhi party chief Subhash Chopra after the grand old party was decimated.

    •

details.title: I love you Dilli waalon: A happy Arvind Kejriwal addresses public
details.content: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal addressed a massive public gathering near party headquarters. Thanking the people of Delhi, the CM said the result will 'lead to a new kind of politics.' Kejriwal will be retaining his post as the Chief Minister for a third consecutive time.

details.title: For his win in Delhi, Kejriwal thanks Lord Hanuman
details.content:
Thanking Lord Hanuman for the sweeping victory in Delhi, Arvind Kejriwal prayed that 'Hanuman Ji keeps showing the right path to us so that we continue to serve people for the next five years.'

AAP leaders celebrate victory near party headquarters. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: BJP set to lose sixth state election in two years
details.content: Delhi state BJP chief Manoj Tiwari had hoped to win 48 seats to enable the party to return to power in Delhi afer over two decades. However, these estimates proved to be incorrect. (READ MORE)

details.title: JP Nadda wishes Kejriwal, says will play role of 'constructive opposition'
details.content: While AAP celebrated its victory, BJP chief JP Nadda congratulated Arvind Kejriwal and AAP. While accepting the mandate of people, Nadda said 'We will play our role as a constructive opposition & raise public issues in the assembly.'

details.title: You have done it: AAP showers love on 'Dilliwaalon'
details.content:
Delhi you have done it!!!

For the first time in the history of India, an election has been won on the basis of work. pic.twitter.com/aPGms4Myfn

— AAP (@AamAadmiParty) February 11, 2020

details.title: Accepting defeat, Manoj Tiwari hopes for 'less blame game, more work'
details.content:
'Very confident that Arvind Kejriwal will work towards the betterment of the people of Delhi. We had a lot of expectations and we will look into our failures and see where we went wrong. This is the time to be strong and I request all BJP workers to stay positive. Extremely glad about the increase in vote share for the BJP in comparison to 2015. The Congress is as good as non-existent in Delhi. We will try that in future blame game reduces and work increases,' Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari said at a press conference in Delhi post his party’s defeat.

BJP state chief Manoj Tiwari took responsibility for the party’s defeat. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)
